meanings.definition: In a sociable or outgoing manner.
meanings.sent1: She greeted everyone gregariously at the party, making sure to talk to each person.
meanings.sent2: The child played gregariously with the other kids in the park, laughing and running around.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wagged its tail gregariously as it approached the new visitors, eager for attention.
meanings.sent4: The sunflowers in the field leaned gregariously towards the sunlight, reaching for its warmth.
meanings.sent5: The old man smiled gregariously at the young couple, reminiscing about his own youth.

meanings.definition: Tending to form a group or live in groups.
meanings.sent1: The gregarious birds chirped gregariously as they flew together in a flock.
meanings.sent2: The gregarious students always sat together in the cafeteria, chatting and laughing.
meanings.sent3: The gregarious ants worked gregariously to build their intricate underground tunnels.
meanings.sent4: The gregarious flowers bloomed gregariously in clusters, creating a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent5: The gregarious wolves howled gregariously to communicate with their pack members.
